title: CANADA STOCKS-Futures edge up as higher gold offsets lower oil
text:
© Reuters. CANADA STOCKS-Futures edge up as higher gold offsets lower oil

Sept 23 (Reuters) - Futures for Canada's main stock index were slightly higher on Monday, as gains in gold prices on global growth worries offset a pullback in oil prices.

September futures on the S&P/TSX index were up 0.04% at 7:15 a.m. ET.

Wholesale trade data for July is due at 8:30 a.m. ET.

The Toronto Stock Exchange S&P/TSX composite index rose 0.25% to 16,899.69 on Friday. Jones Industrial Average e-mini futures were down 0.03% at 7:15 a.m. ET, while S&P 500 e-mini futures were up 0.07% and Nasdaq 100 e-mini futures were up 0.21%. .N

TOP STORIES TOP/CAN

Canada's Brookfield Asset Management and Dubai's Meraas Holding have agreed to form a joint venture valued at 5 billion dirham to own and operate Meraas' retail assets. RESEARCH HIGHLIGHTS RCH/CA

MEG Energy Corp : UBS raises target price to C$6 from C$5.50

Leagold Mining Corp : TD Securities initiates with 'buy', C$4.50 target price

Loblaw Cos Ltd : Scotiabank raises target price to C$78 from C$69

COMMODITIES AT 7:15 a.m. ET COM/WRAP

GCc2 : $1,519.6; +0.77% GOL/

US crude : $57.83; -0.45% O/R

Brent crude : $64.07; -0.33% O/R
